page.title: 15Crawfordton House School
page.content: Crawfordton House is a preparatory school in our area and we interviewed its head,Mr.Morrison. Mr.Morrison always wanted to teach from about the age of 10 and went to college with that ambition in mind.His first job was at a preparatory school in Belfast.He has held his present post for 4 years. If he was not teaching he would love to be a farmer or a theatre director.There are 70 pupils at his school and they do 7 periods/day plus Saturday morning study and have a wide variety of clubs.One third of pupils come from within 50miles,another third come from anywhere in Britain and the last third come from abroad.To be a boarding pupil at Crawfordton costs Â£1100/term and Â£700/term if you are a day pupil. There are 3 term/year.Most parents are farmers,doctors or lawers.
